reviews.review_msg: Sensei Takei is actually the funniest person ever, she's an amazing prof and I learned so much Japanese in such a short amount of time. She focuses on pair work and getting everyone out of their comfort zone and it helps with language learning so much and making so many friends. She is awesome and I wish I had her for every class haha

She's a nice lady but her class is pretty brutal. Everything you learn is self taught and her lectures are confusing and way too fast. Don't even get me started about contacting her outside of class - it's like she's allergic to email or something. You have to mark your own workbook, and she marks quizzes super harshly. Would not recommend Naoko...
Naoko Sensei is a great professor. She's my goat for real.
She's literally the worst prof in sfu. I took her class on last semester and her slides and quizzes are super unclear. Also, she's mean as hell. Especially, she never replies on student's email.
Awful teaching
Sweetest prof ever. Really believes and cares about each student. Super fun and engaging class plus she's super funnyâ€¦. you'll always be laughing and learning productively in her class.

she lovesss to do pair work and i really liked that! really helps to get out of your comfort zone and talk to your classmates. as long as you study, her quizzes are relatively easy to follow along and no surprises along the way, so all the stuff we already covered. she's just so nice and chill i'd love to have her for all of my japanese courses!

Amazon teachers and lectures. Much more fun to learn Japanese with her. Lovely and happy to answer any questions you had. 

As you all know, this is a language class, speaking matters, shows by oral test and group presentation. 

Be aware of weekly quizzes, group project, presentation. 

Sometimes participant extra activities such as ramen tour.
The class have homework and quiz every week. She is s nice professor that can make you like this language.

Pretty good choice as elective course. Naoko always let us make different groups to practice which is really useful.  
If you are interested in Japanese, do not hesitate to take this course.

The class can be a bit intimidating, but Naoko makes it approachable and fun. You never feel stupid, despite her offhanded remarks. Funny, approachable, and a great teacher, Naoko is among one of the best profs at SFU.

I would take her class again if you are planning to continue taking Japanese class in SFU. Although she might be a bit difficult, if you are passionate about learning Japanese language she will guide you well.

Sensei is insanely caring and fun, she makes lessons interesting and engaging. All the people in the class are friends by the end of the semester. Honestly, I've never felt as comfortable presenting in a class as I've felt in Japanese class. Amazing environment and a good amount of work goes into preparing our videos and learning material. 10/5
Best elective class ever. No cons all pros.

she's amazing, but japanese courses are really difficult. Don't take this class unless you're willing to put in a lot of time. Naoko is an amazing teacher though. Super funny, and really cares about her students!!!
ONE OF THE BEST PROFS EVER. Extremely caring for her students and lots of fun in class. Go take her class and enjoy your semester.
Quiz every class but really helps. Work hard can guarantee a good grade. VERY KIND!!!!!

Recently took an intersession with her, one of the more interesting and active courses I've taken in university thus far. Very kind and very approachable prof, you'll be in good hands. Pro tip: Look for resources outside of class like friends who speak Japanese, TV shows and music since it helps you immerse yourself in your study.

Quizzes every class. Lots of material and words to remember. You must study or you will fall behind and things will get hard. She will pick on people in the class to answer questions. Participation does matter, show up to all her classes. Somewhat tough marker, i feel like she is biased towards specific students. Listening part of the exams is hard

Definitely a class that you have to put all your effort in, slacking off or falling behind on the material won't do you any good. Quizzes are at the very beginning of every class. Also, make sure you know  your stuff cause she will usually pick on people for the class activities.
She is the best prof I have ever met in SFU. She explains everything clear, and loves to interact with student. Good prof!

The online section was decent and the TM wasn't bad. I would assume online vs in-person is more difficult but if you study well and are able to practice a lot, then you should be okay. Try and review every day - it really helps, especially in the beginning when you have to memorize the hiragana and katakana. The TM is available for help if you ask.
Naoko sensei is soooooo nice

Taking Japanese with Naoko Sensei is the best decision I have ever made in SFU. She is an awesome professor, and it was actually really fun going to her classes, not just for attendance and quizzes. She has always been very caring, and she marks fairly. If you do study for quizzes and put effort into the group project, an A wouldn't be impossible.
Amazing prof, I would recommend Naoko over any other Japanese instructors at SFU.

Naoko is the best professor I've met so far in SFU. She not only knows a lot about Japanese language, she also makes the language fun and interesting for students to learn. If you ever want to take Japanese, take it with Naoko. You won't be disappointed!
BEST prof @SFU.

Took the intersession section this summer and it turned out to be the best course I've ever taken in college.Lectures were interesting and helpful. She intends to develop your interests in Japanese, to show you the best part of this amazing language. Also she  focus on what you did good in oral and writing exams instead of being picky to students .
The class is interesting and helpful.However, the vocab is hard to remember.
The prof never shows up. This TA is really mean. The online distance course is really tough. The course outline is unreasonable.The worst TA I had.
Best professor I had in my experience as a SFU student. Take her classes at any opportunity.
Online course no teaching done. Very unreasonable prof. Will try to avoid in future.
A very lovely and helpful professor. Very charismatic and funny.
good prof! she's willing to help and is very friendly!
She's a very nice prof! Friendly, easy-going, encouraging!

I love this prof!! The course is hard though (if you're lazy like me - coz same with every language course, you'll end up having to memorize stuff. But she's so helpful and cheer u up. Bad side - quiz every class lol. Good side, if thinking of taking Jap, then choose Naoko, best Jap prof ever!
She is extremely helpful, kind and funny. If you are going to take any Japanese course you have to take it with her!

Considering that this is a distance course for beginner's japanese, it's freakin hard. Although the instructor was Naoko, she never showed up, not even for final, but w/e.. If you are taking this distance and u've never had experience in jap, good luck! listening comprehension during final was sooo fast, written was sooo long too.. total 200+ marks
She's a wonderful teacher. Very clear and helpful. And she tries to make the lessons as interesting as possibl.e
Great Jap. teacher! Very focused on students' progress and trying to improve student's ability to speaking Japanese. Always smiles and making fun in her classes.
She's the best language teacher I ever had >0<. you'll ace the exams and quizzes as long as you study a bit prior to~

One of the best instructors ever. She is more interested in how you progress and improve you Japanese. Extremely helpful and easy to get along with. Class is really easy as long as you put in some effort. The class average was 80%..
